RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 10000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,000 (Lesser Claiming Races For $3,500 (AB $4,500) At Century Mile Not Considered In E ligibility). Alberta Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OMEGASSHOOTINGSTAR trailed the field from the four path, was roused in the final turn, closed steadily and got up just in time. CHARMING VINTAGE contested the pace inside of REMARKABLE ELI, gained a short lead in the far turn, saw margins diminish into the stretch, drifted out under left-handed encouragement, and was caught before the wire. REMARKABLE ELI show early speed outside then sat in striking position from the three path, rallied into the drive inside of OMEGASSHOOTINGSTAR then was checked deep stretch after losing his path. BEAUGATTI tracked from the two path, chased, and failed to threaten. CHESTER SLEW chased four to five wide and tired. CARRERA CABALLO shifted out to the four path in the backstretch, and was outrun. TRAINER OBJECTION- An objection lodged by the trainer of REMARKABLE ELI against the rider of OMEGASSHOOTINGSTAR and CHARMING VINTAGE alleging interference deep stretch. After review by the Board of Stewards, CHARMING VINTAGE was disqualified and placed third for interference to REMARKABLE ELI. The objection lodged against OMEGASSHOOTINGSTAR was disallowed.

ENTRY.NAME: Omegasshootingstar
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed 4w, roused, closed steadily, got up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 87. Claiming Purse 15500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $16,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SMARTY RIVER PANTS set for speed from between foes but was outsprinted to the turn, uncoiled a rail bid into the stretch, took control and edged clear. AMUSING WAY vied inside to the opening turn, gained the lead in the final turn, edged away and was out finished. AWHITESPORTSCOAT opted to settle off the early pace, gained late under the encouragement, and needed more ground. SCHOCHOH attended the early pace from the five path, produced a mild bid into the stretch, and flattened. ISLE OF SKYE fractious in the gate, chased outside then fanned four wide in the far turn, lost path at the head of the stretch and finished evenly. ARGENTINA CRIES (IRE) contended the early pace from between foes, was unable to move on with rivals and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Amusing Way
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside, led, edged away, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Smarty River Pants
ENTRY.COMMENT: early speed, bid inside, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Schochoh
ENTRY.OWNER: Poitras Racing Stable and O'Hagan Colleen

ENTRY.NAME: Isle of Skye
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious, chased outside, lost path, evenly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 10000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (Lesser Claiming Races Not Considered In Eligibility). AB Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUMEIRAH COAST stumbled leaving, vied outside of DREADNAUGHT through the backstretch then was approached by SILVER SPUN in the far turn, responded to pressure at the head of the lane, battled determinedly inside to get some breathing room, and held sway. PERDITION was checked leaving the chute, tracked just off the rail, gained closer order nearing the stretch, rallied between rivals late, dug in to score the place spot in a multi-horse scramble to the finish. SILVER SPUN sat just off the pace outside, moved up alongside JUMEIRAH COAST to test the lead, rallied between foes and was bested late, but was able to hold on for show. KOVACS tracked outside through the backstretch, was asked to quicken entering the final turn, moved up menacingly outside but was out finished after a game effort. DREADNAUGHT vied inside through the backstretch, was unable to move on with rival, kept on inside, and weakened. FROBISHER BAY sat in range, and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Perdition
ENTRY.OWNER: Salt River Holdings Inc and Viking Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: checked, tracked inside, rallied between, dug in

ENTRY.NAME: Jumeirah Coast
ENTRY.OWNER: Smith Doug D Dialed In Racing Stable Parrish Jeff and Graham Thoroughbreds
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled, vied outside, determinedly, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Spun
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside, bid 1/4pl, rallied between, held show

ENTRY.NAME: Kovacs
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked outside, quicken, bid outside, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 90. Claiming Purse 15500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $16,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WANDERING WEST raced in close quarters leaving the opening turn from along the rail, lacked running room in the far turn, angled out sharply at the three-sixteenth pole, and won going away. LONESOME CAT saved ground early, lodged a bid near the quarter pole, dueled outside of THE BEAT, and won the nod for second. THE BEAT vied for the early lead, dueled outside of SIMMS to the final turn, shook loose of the aforementioned then was under pressure late stretch and was worn down. SIMMS contested the pace from just off the rail, dueled inside of THE BEAT but was unable to move on into the stretch and weakened in the late stages. NEXT JOURNEY sat in range from the three path, and failed to threaten in the drive. LANNY MAC went four to five wide through the opening turn, had no response when roused, and retreated. TUCKER TIME stalked outside, and tired early.

ENTRY.NAME: Simms
ENTRY.OWNER: Dialed In Racing Stable and Johannsen Kevin

ENTRY.NAME: The Beat
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, dueled outside, dueled stretch, worn down

ENTRY.NAME: Wandering West
ENTRY.COMMENT: close quarters, lacked room inside, going away

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 76. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 19000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING $12,000 WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR ALBERTA BREDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,000. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOOL TIME quickly took command, remained unchallenged entering the stretch, and opened up under light handling. ESCROW STYLE brushed leaving then trailed the field, closed gamely outside, and got up just in time for place honors. MOHAMAD broke inward, chased inside under urging, and was hooked late. DOUSEAWHATISEA reluctant to load then loaded without the rider, sat just off the pace, went in pursuit of the leader in the final turn, and had no rally in the drive. VANTASTICCANAVERAL offered a late mild bid. BE NAUGHTY WITH ME broke outward brushing ESCROW STYLE, tracked wide through the backstretch, and came up empty. MIDNITE CHILL tracked outside, and lacked a bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Mohamad
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke inward, chased inside, hooked late

ENTRY.NAME: Douseawhatisea
ENTRY.OWNER: Dory Bill Dory Sandy Ference Adam and Frey Racing Stable

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 96. Allowance Purse 23000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HYPERFOCUS angled to the rail approaching the first turn, saved ground in the two path, roused along the rail then grabbed the lead at the eighth pole, and kicked clear. SOLO RING sent for speed then emerged the leader leaving the opening turn, showed the way through the backstretch, was overtaken in the final furlong, and finished up second best. SLAATS raced four wide into the opening turn, moved up closer in the three path, chased the leader in the final turn, and weakened late. VIATURE raced at the back of the pack, and rallied belatedly. ASYOUBELIEVE vied inside but was outsprinted in the turn, lacked running room leaving the backstretch, loomed boldly near the three-sixteenth pole, and wilted. ROCKTILLYOUDROP settled outside, took closer order in the five path, and failed to threaten. RUMOHR REIGNS sat midpack from the four path, and tired early.

ENTRY.NAME: Asyoubelieve
ENTRY.OWNER: Shot In The Dark Racing Corp.
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside, lacked room, bid 3/16pl, wilted

ENTRY.NAME: Hyperfocus
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, bid inside, kicked clear

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Mike Heitzmann, Jill Heitzmann & WinStar Farm, LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Count Lathum H. CENTURY MILE RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 87. Stakes Purse 50000. A HANDICAP STAKE FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS. A fee of $100.00 required to nominate. A payment of $500.00 is required to pass the entry box and an additional $400.00 is required to start. The purse will be divided $30,000 to the owner of the winner, $10,000 to th e second place finisher, $5,000 to the third place finisher, $2,500 to the fourth place finisher and $1,000 to the fifth place finisher. A payment of $500 will be paid to all horses who start and finish 6th or worse. High weights preferred. Starters to be named through the entry box by the closing time of entries. The field will be limited to 12 starters. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AMERICAN BLAZE saved ground while three to four wide, advanced outside through the final turn, responded to handling in a long drive, dug in gamely deep stretch, and narrowly prevailed. KAUAI DAN was crowded at the start, dropped back in the opening turn, gained closer order from along the rail leaving the backstretch, struck the front after the quarter pole, weakened deep stretch under handling, and was bested. KYSTONE saved from the rail, drove four wide on the final turn, chased the leader under steady urging, and was outkicked. RIVERSIDE trailed in the early stages, raced wide through the backstretch, came under heavy urging into the stretch, was gaining late, and needed more ground. IT'S A FACT was outsprinted to the turn, raced in closest pursuit of the leader, and lacked a rally. CALI CONQUEST raced three wide in the opening turn, was widest through the backstretch, and past tiring rivals. MUDINATOR sent for outside speed, was reserved off the pacesetter from the three path, and came up empty in drive. NORTHERN JEWEL saved ground and lacked a bid. READYTOTAPNSING hustled to the front setting the early pace, moved to good margins through the backstretch, saw the gap close nearing the quarter pole and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Kauai Dan
ENTRY.COMMENT: crowded, dropped back, led, weakened, bested

ENTRY.NAME: Kystone
ENTRY.OWNER: Empire Equestrian Kerredge Farm Stock Curtis McPherson Cam and Lenheiser Ray

ENTRY.NAME: American Blaze
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved 3-4w, bid outside, dug in gamely, prevailed, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Riverside
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, wide, urged, gained late, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Century Mile H. CENTURY MILE RACE 8 1M Dirt CR: 98. Stakes Purse 100000. A BLACK TYPE HANDICAP STAKE FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS AND UPWARD. A fee of $100.00 required to nominate. A payment of $1000.00 is required to pass the entry box and an additional $900.00 is required to start. The purse will be divided $60,000 to the owner of t he winner, $20,000 to the second place finisher, $10,000 to the third place finisher, $5,000 to the fourth place finisher and $2,000 to the fifth place finisher. A payment of $500 will be paid to all horses who start and finish 6th or worse. High weights preferred. Starters to be named through the entry box by the closing time of entries. The field will be limited to 12 starters. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SMART AS ME steadied in close quarters early, advanced inside through the backstretch then set sights on a weary GLAVA, swept the lead then drew out while kept to task. AT ATTENTION rated well off the ambitious leader, drove three wide at the quarter pole, and rallied through the stretch but was no match for the winner in the drive. GLAVA cleared the field early, opened up to a significant lead up the backstretch, increased the distance between him and field through the far turn, saw the margins rapidly decrease after the quarter pole, drifted out while showing signs of tiring, and was able to hold on for show. BOITANO raced near the back, advanced inside nearing the quarter pole, and lacked the closing response that was needed. DRINKING AGAIN raced four wide from the second flight, and lacked a rally. GREEK GEEK unhurried early, and lacked a kick. RACE HOME went three-wide into the opening turn, trailed through the backstretch, and lacked a serious bid. COUNTRIFIED failed to be a factor. QUINTO SOL fanned three wide through the opening turn, reserved off the early pacesetter and tired early.

ENTRY.NAME: At Attention
ENTRY.OWNER: Anderson, Dr. Bryan C. and Carol

ENTRY.NAME: Smart as Me
ENTRY.OWNER: Highfield Investment Group Inc and Dialed In Racing Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Boitano
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E Danard Don B and Rozenek Conrad

ENTRY.NAME: Glava
ENTRY.COMMENT: opened up, drifted out, held show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CENTURY MILE RACE 9 7F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 19500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING $17,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $17,500. Alberta Bred Claiming Price $22,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DECOY settled midpack, drove five wide off the final turn, responded to handling then grabbed the lead at the eighth pole, dug in to prevail. I'M DASHING raced four wide into the backstretch, took closer order nearing the quarter pole, moved up menacingly at the head of the stretch and was outkicked. MACHINE trailed the field, roused into the lane, and closed late to earn show. RAILWAY raced in closest pursuit of the leader while five wide, closed the gap quickly through the final turn, rallied four wide entering the stretch and was rundown deep stretch. RUNNINFORCOVER produced a mild late rally. SILVERFOOT rallied belatedly. LIL ZAPPER broke alertly then cleared the front, opened up to good margins through the backstretch, was under attack after the quarter pole, and retreated in the stretch. FATHER O'FLAHERTY outrun throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Lil Zapper
ENTRY.OWNER: C and H Duggan Farms Ltd

ENTRY.NAME: Father O'Flaherty
ENTRY.OWNER: Antoine Vern and DLK Racing Stables
